gov.nasa.arc.mct.services.activity
Class TimeService

java.lang.Object
  gov.nasa.arc.mct.services.activity.TimeService

public abstract class TimeService
extends java.lang.Object

This interface provides time related functionality for the current activity. Activity time is based on the time in the current mission which may be a simulation (in which case the time is different than the wall clock time and clock ticks may deviate significantly) or be slightly delayed to reflect latency between the vehicle and the ground systems. An instance can be obtained through OSGI, using code like: 

    org.osgi.framework.BundleContext bc = ... // will be obtained through an activator
    ServiceReference ref = bc.getServiceReference(TimeService.class.getName());
    if (ref != null) 
      TimeService registry = (TimeService) bc.getService(ref);
    ...
    bc.ungetServiceReference(ref);
An instance of this class can also be obtained using the OSGI declarative service functionality.

Method Detail

getCurrentTime

public abstract long getCurrentTime()
Returns the current time for the active activity. The time is based on the Unix Epoch (Java time) which are the milliseconds since midnight, January 1, 1970 UTC

Returns:
time for the current activity

getTimeSystems

public java.lang.String[] getTimeSystems()
Returns time systems supported by this time service.

time systems

getTimeSystemId

public java.lang.String getTimeSystemId()
Gets the time system id key for this component if it exists. Time service implementations that support multiple time service types should override this method to provide identification.

Returns:
idKey Time System Id if it exists, null otherwise
